fields.name: Moon
fields.description: Experience the breathtaking beauty of Earth's closest neighbor. Walk on the lunar surface, explore historic landing sites, and witness Earth-rise from the Sea of Tranquility. Our state-of-the-art lunar base offers comfortable accommodations and guided tours of the most spectacular crater formations.

fields.name: Mars
fields.description: Discover the Red Planet's ancient mysteries and modern marvels. Visit Olympus Mons, the largest volcano in our solar system, explore the vast Valles Marineris canyon system, and search for signs of ancient water in the polar ice caps. Our Mars habitat provides Earth-like gravity zones for your comfort.

fields.name: Europa
fields.description: Journey to Jupiter's fascinating ice moon. Dive beneath the frozen surface to explore the subsurface ocean that may harbor alien life. Witness the spectacular ice geysers erupting from the surface, and enjoy the stunning view of Jupiter filling half the sky. Our submersible research station offers unprecedented access to this alien world.

fields.name: Titan
fields.description: Explore Saturn's largest moon, the only place in our solar system besides Earth with liquid lakes and rivers. Float in the thick atmosphere with our specialized gliders, cruise the hydrocarbon seas in our methane-proof vessels, and visit the mysterious ice volcanoes. The orange-tinted skies and eternal twilight create an otherworldly ambiance.

fields.name: Enceladus
fields.description: Visit Saturn's ice moon and witness the magnificent ice geysers erupting from the south pole. Our orbital station provides perfect views of these water plumes shooting hundreds of miles into space. Ski down the smooth ice plains, explore the mysterious 'tiger stripes,' and search for signs of life in the subsurface ocean.

fields.name: Pluto
fields.description: Journey to the edge of our solar system and discover the heart-shaped glacier of Pluto. Explore the frozen nitrogen plains of Sputnik Planitia, climb the towering water-ice mountains, and witness the blue atmospheric haze during Pluto's brief 'summer.' Our expedition base is located at the historic New Horizons flyby point.
